creditline:
The William M. Ladd Collection
Gift of Herschel V. Jones, 1916
text: Domenico Campagnola's knowledge of the human body and its muscular structure was due also to his participation in the illustration of Vesalius' book De Fabrica (shown in the bookcase at the center of this room). The artist is considered the probable author of the background in the book's anatomical illustrations, which represents segments of the landscape of the Italian city of Padua.
title: Battle of Naked Men
